meanings.definition: Resembling a hippopotamus in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The large, round shape of the hippish toy reminded me of a hippopotamus.
meanings.sent2: The hippish creature waddled slowly towards the river, just like a hippopotamus.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't help but chuckle at the sight of the hippish costume at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her movements were as heavy and lumbering as a hippish giant.
meanings.sent5: The hippish figure in the painting looked both comical and majestic.

meanings.definition: Having characteristics associated with the counterculture movement of the 1960s.
meanings.sent1: The band's music had a hippish vibe, reminiscent of the 1960s era.
meanings.sent2: She wore a hippish headband and bell-bottoms, embracing the retro style.
meanings.sent3: His hippish ideals clashed with the traditional values of his family.
meanings.sent4: The hippish artwork on the walls transported visitors back to a rebellious time.
meanings.sent5: The room was decorated in a colorful, hippish manner, reflecting a free-spirited attitude.

meanings.definition: Showing a relaxed or casual attitude.
meanings.sent1: She greeted us with a hippish smile and a carefree wave.
meanings.sent2: The hippish atmosphere of the beach party put everyone at ease.
meanings.sent3: His hippish approach to life often led to unexpected adventures.
meanings.sent4: The cafe had a hippish charm, perfect for lazy afternoons spent chatting.
meanings.sent5: The hammock swayed gently in the breeze, creating a hippish vibe of relaxation.
